newsitem.title: UK: Conrad in talks to buy Sheffield Utd club.
newsitem.headline: Conrad in talks to buy Sheffield Utd club.

text.p: UK leisure group Conrad Plc said on Tuesday it was involved in talks about buying Sheffield United Football Club.

The terse announcement from Conrad followed weekend press speculation that the club may float on the London stock exchange through a 10 million stg reverse takeover with Conrad, which owns the Bobby Charlton sports business and the sports clothing brand Le Coq Sportif.
Last week Stephen Hinchliffe, the former chairman of the collapsed retailing Facia group, sold his 10 percent Sheffield United stake so the sale could go ahead.
Conrad is believed to have wanted Hinchliffe to cut ties with the club.
The possibility of a deal comes after a long search for the right football deal by Conrad which moved back from the brink of bankruptcy four years ago.
It now sees football as the natural way to expand the group's business.
